Grouped_Utterances: I’ve been thinking about my upcoming move and how it’ll affect my kids.
I think so. I’ve been less anxious about the move, which is a relief.
We watched a movie together, and it felt nice to just hang out. I think it brought us a little closer. I hope it will help me feel more connected to my family overall. It’s important to me.

It was calming, especially during stressful moments. I felt more centered. I felt happy during the movie, and afterward, I was relieved. I realized that spending time with him doesn’t have to be complicated. I’m feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. I want it to be a positive experience for everyone.

Yes, I want to. I think I’ll try to visit him more often. I think we’ll talk to them about it more and maybe visit the area before we move. Maybe involve them in the packing process and let them choose some things to bring. I think that would make them feel included. Your intentions are clear, and that’s a great foundation. As we wrap up today, let’s set a goal for you to have an open conversation with your kids about the move and involve them in the packing process. How does that sound? That sounds perfect!
